DataElement.preferredDefinition: Paired with Latitude [2352], this represents the point location of the individual's residence on the earth"s surface.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Represents the point location of the individual's residence on the Earth's surface.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The ethical principle or legal right that a physician or other health professional will hold secret all information relating to a patient, unless the patient gives consent permitting disclosure.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Treatment of information so that it is not divulged in ways that are inconsistent with the understanding of the original disclosure. Particularly, the ethical principle or legal right that a physician or other health professional will hold secret all information relating to a patient, unless the patient gives consent permitting disclosure.

Property.preferredDefinition: The angular distance of a point on the earth's surface east or west of an arbitrarily defined meridian, usually the Greenwich meridian.

Concepts.definition: An imaginary great circle on the surface of a heavenly body passing through the poles at right angles to the equator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: all components of an address, including building number, street name and type, city, state, postal code, and country.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Removed special character from definition. 6/19/09 mcooper

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A 11 digit number with up to six decimal places and an explicit decimal point that represents a geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: Longitude Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: The point location is expressed as a coordinate pair of latitude and longitude values determined by any one of several methods: for example, geocoding, address matching, GPS readings, and interpolation from paper or electronic maps. Most of the time this information is provided by a geocoding vendor service. Alternatively, a central registry staff manually assigns the code. This item is not coded by the hospital.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 16, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)
